thread.title_full: HAPPENING TODAY: Search continues for suspects in deaths of BR c - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: FOX8Live.com Staff
title: HAPPENING TODAY: Search continues for suspects in deaths of BR c
text:
Sanity hearing for accomplice in murders of Metairie father and son
In Jefferson Parish today, a woman accused of driving the getaway car in a shooting that killed a Metairie father and son is scheduled in court for a sanity hearing. Haraquon Degruy faces charges for her alleged role in the deaths of David and Nicholas Pence. The sheriff's office says in April, Degruy and Dexter Allen were breaking into cars in the Metairie neighborhood where the Pence's lived. Allen is accused of going into the home, stealing several items and killing the father and son with a shotgun. Today's hearing takes place at 9 a.m. at the Gretna Courthouse.
Suspects sought in deaths of Baton Rouge couple
Law enforcement officers across the state search for two people they want to question in connection to a kidnapping and double murder of a Baton Rouge couple. They're also searching for a white, 2007 Chevy pick-up truck with license plate number "c287533". Police found the bodies of Denis and Suzanne Duplantier Monday inside their own vehicle at a truck stop in Hammond off Interstate 12. Police say someone abducted the couple from their home in Baton Rouge and strangled them.
